ready.description: The Ready phase is where users create and share content, like courses, training materials, or best practices. This is the preparation and content creation stage.

run.description: The Run phase is where the actual training or learning experience happens. This could be synchronous (like a workshop) or asynchronous self-paced learning.

huddle.description: The Huddle phase is what makes us unique - it's the post-training collaboration space where participants apply what they learned, share experiences, and learn from each other's implementations.
features: Build a knowledge bank of real practices
Collect qualitative and quantitative data on what's working

post_training_focus.description: HuddleUp's unique strength is what happens AFTER the training or course. We focus on helping users apply what they learn and share their experiences with peers.
benefits: Building a searchable knowledge bank of real practices

peer_learning.description: Teams build a bank of practices as they each share, with peer feedback that is both qualitative and quantitative.

workshop_enhancement.before: Traditional one-day workshop with PowerPoint and group activities
benefits: Share how they're implementing the learning
Get feedback from peers on their implementations
Access a growing bank of successful practices
Track both individual and cohort progress

interview_highlights.vision: We believe the real value of training comes from what happens after the session - when people actually apply what they learned.
interview_highlights.differentiator: Unlike traditional platforms that focus just on content delivery, we create a space for teams to learn from each other's real-world implementations.
interview_highlights.roi_focus: Our platform helps organizations track not just completion rates, but actual implementation success through peer feedback and data collection.
